title: Real observers solving imaginary problems
abstract:
The sphere partition function is one of the simplest euclidean gravity
computations. It is usually interpreted as count of states. However, the one
loop gravity correction contains a dimension depenent phase factor, $i^{D+2}$,
which seems confusing for such an interpretation. We show that, after including
an observer, this phase gets cancelled for the quantity that should correspond
to a count of states.
